title: MRI Software
headline: Open and connected property management platform for commercial and residential real estate.
description: MRI Software is one of the most comprehensive real estate technology platforms in the industry, providing solutions for commercial and residential property management, accounting, lease management, investment management, and facilities management. MRI serves over 50,000 clients globally with an open and connected platform that integrates with 200+ partners. Key products include MRI Platform X for AI-powered property management, MRI Investment Management, MRI Angus for facilities, and MRI Lease Intelligence. Founded in 1971, MRI is one of the longest-standing CRE technology companies.
short_description: Open and connected property management platform for commercial and residential real estate.

features.name: MRI Platform X
features.description: Next-generation AI-powered property management platform for commercial and residential portfolios.

features.name: Commercial Management
features.description: Full-stack commercial property management with accounting, lease admin, and tenant management.

features.name: Residential Management
features.description: Property management for multifamily, student, affordable, and senior housing.

features.name: Accounting & Financials
features.description: Comprehensive real estate accounting with GL, AP/AR, budgeting, and financial reporting.

features.name: MRI Investment Management
features.description: Portfolio and fund management for real estate investors with performance analytics.

features.name: Investor Reporting
features.description: Automated investor reports, distribution calculations, and waterfall modeling.

features.name: Data & Analytics
features.description: Portfolio-level dashboards, benchmarking, and business intelligence tools.

features.name: MRI Angus
features.description: Facilities management platform for service requests, visitor security, preventive maintenance, and tenant engagement.

features.name: MRI Maintenance
features.description: Work order management, asset tracking, and preventive maintenance scheduling.

features.name: Tenant Experience
features.description: Branded portals, building directories, and communication tools for tenant engagement.

features.name: Lease Intelligence
features.description: AI-powered lease abstraction and management for commercial portfolios.

features.name: AI Platform
features.description: Embedded AI across MRI solutions for automation, insights, and decision support.

features.name: 200+ Integrations
features.description: Open platform connecting with 200+ technology partners via APIs.

pros: One of the most comprehensive CRE tech platforms — covers commercial, residential, and investment management
50+ year track record — longest-standing CRE technology company
Open platform with 200+ integration partners
Strong facilities management via MRI Angus
Global reach serving 50,000+ clients
cons: Complex platform with steep learning curve
Enterprise pricing — not transparent or accessible to small firms
Product sprawl from acquisitions can create inconsistent user experiences
Implementation timelines can be lengthy

company.name: MRI Software LLC
company.funding: Private, backed by GI Partners & TA Associates

title: Building Engines
headline: AI-powered property operations platform built for commercial real estate.
description: Building Engines (by JLL Technologies) is a property operations platform for commercial real estate owners and operators that streamlines tenant service, building operations, risk management, and tenant experience. The platform covers work order management, preventive maintenance, vendor management, tenant communication, inspection tracking, and certificate of insurance management. Building Engines helps property teams deliver consistent operational excellence while reducing risk and improving tenant satisfaction across office, industrial, retail, and mixed-use portfolios.
short_description: AI-powered property operations platform built for CRE.

features.name: Work Order Management
features.description: Create, assign, track, and resolve work orders with automated routing and SLA tracking.

features.name: Preventive Maintenance
features.description: Schedule recurring maintenance tasks with equipment tracking and compliance documentation.

features.name: Inspections
features.description: Digital inspection checklists with photo capture and issue escalation workflows.

features.name: Vendor Management
features.description: Vendor onboarding, performance tracking, and work order assignment.

features.name: Certificate of Insurance
features.description: Automated COI collection, tracking, and compliance monitoring for tenants and vendors.

features.name: Incident Reporting
features.description: Digital incident capture with photo documentation and escalation workflows.

features.name: Compliance Tracking
features.description: Track regulatory and safety compliance requirements across the portfolio.

features.name: Tenant Portal
features.description: Branded self-service portal for work orders, communications, and building information.

features.name: Visitor Management
features.description: Digital visitor registration, badge printing, and access management.

features.name: Amenity Booking
features.description: Online booking for conference rooms, amenities, and shared spaces.

Strong risk management features (COI, inspections, incidents)
Backed by JLL Technologies
Good tenant experience tools
cons: Enterprise pricing only
Part of JLL — may not suit firms using competing brokerages
UI can feel dated compared to newer competitors
Limited property management accounting features

title: Re-Leased
headline: Cloud-based commercial property management software.
description: Re-Leased is a cloud-native commercial property management platform purpose-built for commercial real estate. Unlike residential-first platforms adapted for commercial, Re-Leased was designed from the ground up for office, retail, industrial, and mixed-use properties. The platform automates lease management, rent collection, maintenance, accounting, and tenant communication. It features automated rent reviews, CPI adjustments, turnover rent calculations, and integrates deeply with Xero and QuickBooks for accounting. Used globally with strong presence in ANZ, UK, and North America.
short_description: Cloud-based commercial property management software.

features.name: Lease Tracking
features.description: Centralized lease management with critical dates, rent reviews, and option tracking.

features.name: Automated Rent Reviews
features.description: CPI-linked and market rent review automation with tenant notification workflows.

features.name: Turnover Rent
features.description: Automated turnover rent calculations and collection for retail tenants.

features.name: Document Management
features.description: Digital lease document storage with search and version tracking.

features.name: Maintenance Management
features.description: Work order creation, assignment, and tracking with tenant self-service.

features.name: Inspections
features.description: Mobile property inspection tools with photo capture and reporting.

features.name: Tenant Communication
features.description: Automated communications for rent reminders, maintenance updates, and announcements.

features.name: Xero Integration
features.description: Deep two-way integration with Xero for automated financial sync.

features.name: QuickBooks Integration
features.description: Automated sync with QuickBooks Online for accounting workflows.

features.name: Financial Reporting
features.description: Portfolio dashboards, owner reports, and financial performance analytics.

pros: Purpose-built for commercial — not adapted from residential
Excellent Xero and QuickBooks integrations
Strong automated rent review and CPI adjustment features
Modern cloud-native platform with good UX
cons: Smaller market presence than Yardi or MRI in the US
Pricing not publicly listed
Limited functionality for residential properties
Fewer integrations than larger platforms

title: Blooma
headline: AI-powered CRE lending and intelligence platform.
description: Blooma is an AI-powered CRE lending intelligence platform that empowers commercial real estate lenders — from community banks to large institutions — with real-time insights and seamless automation. Blooma isn't an LOS, CRM, or data provider; it's the insights engine that augments existing tech stacks, transforming raw data into actionable intelligence for deal evaluation, portfolio monitoring, and risk management. The platform automates manual data entry, provides real-time deal evaluation, continuous portfolio monitoring with instant alerts, and integrates with existing lending systems.
short_description: AI-powered CRE lending and intelligence platform.

features.name: Automated Underwriting
features.description: AI-powered deal analysis automating manual data entry and document processing.

features.name: Property Valuation
features.description: Real-time property data and valuation insights for informed lending decisions.

features.name: Risk Assessment
features.description: Comprehensive risk scoring with market data, property conditions, and borrower analysis.

features.name: Real-Time Monitoring
features.description: Continuous portfolio surveillance with alerts for changing property values and market conditions.

features.name: Proactive Alerts
features.description: Instant notifications when portfolio properties show signs of deterioration or opportunity.

features.name: Portfolio Analytics
features.description: Dashboard views of portfolio health, concentration risk, and performance trends.

features.name: Data Automation
features.description: Automated extraction and processing of financial documents and property data.

features.name: Tech Stack Integration
features.description: Connect with existing LOS, CRM, and core banking systems seamlessly.

features.name: Workflow Automation
features.description: Streamlined lending workflows from origination to portfolio monitoring.

pros: Purpose-built for CRE lenders — not a generic fintech tool
Augments existing tech stack rather than replacing it
Real-time portfolio monitoring catches risks early
Strong customer testimonials from banks like C3Bank and Sunwest Bank
cons: Pricing not publicly available
Requires existing CRE lending tech stack to maximize value
Relatively small company with limited market recognition
Not suitable for equity investors or property managers

title: Accruent
headline: Facilities, asset, and lease management software for the built environment.
description: Accruent is a comprehensive facilities, asset, and real estate management software platform serving organizations across healthcare, retail, education, government, and commercial real estate. The platform includes IWMS capabilities for space management, lease administration and accounting, capital planning, maintenance management, and IoT-based monitoring. Accruent's solutions help organizations optimize their physical resources, manage lease portfolios for compliance (ASC 842, IFRS 16), track assets throughout their lifecycle, and streamline facilities operations. Acquired by Fortive Corporation.
short_description: Facilities, asset, and lease management software for the built environment.

title: Planon
headline: Market-leading smart sustainable building management software.
description: Planon is a market-leading Integrated Workplace Management System (IWMS) and smart building management platform, recognized by Verdantix, Gartner, IDC, and Frost & Sullivan. The platform enables connected places where people work, live, play, and learn, covering real estate portfolio management, space and workplace management, facilities and maintenance management, lease accounting, sustainability tracking, and field services. Planon serves global enterprises including universities (LSE), construction firms (Royal BAM Group), and corporate occupiers.

title: Prophia
headline: AI-powered lease abstraction and management for commercial real estate.
description: Prophia is an AI-powered lease abstraction and management platform purpose-built for commercial real estate owners and operators. The platform transforms static lease documents into dynamic, living abstracts that allow teams to verify, analyze, and manage lease obligations with confidence. Prophia processes 493M+ square feet across 4,425+ buildings and 22,000+ tenants. Key use cases include leasing (stacking plans, benchmarks, critical dates), acquisitions (due diligence, rent roll reconciliation), property management (CAM reconciliation, budgeting), and investor reporting. Trusted by firms like Nuveen, RXR, and Spear Street Capital.
short_description: AI-powered lease abstraction and management for commercial real estate.

features.name: AI-Powered Abstraction
features.description: Drag-and-drop lease upload with instant AI abstraction and data structuring.

features.name: Quality Assurance
features.description: CRE expert audit process ensuring accuracy through detailed review.

features.name: Living Abstracts
features.description: Dynamic abstracts that consolidate dozens of documents into one verifiable source of truth.

features.name: Prophia Abstract (Instant)
features.description: Free self-serve tool for instant, accurate lease summaries — no setup required.

features.name: Self-Updating Stacking Plans
features.description: Real-time visual stacking plans that update automatically as lease data changes.

features.name: Critical Date Tracking
features.description: Automated alerts for expirations, renewals, and option exercise deadlines.

features.name: Lease Benchmarking
features.description: Compare lease terms against portfolio and market benchmarks.

features.name: Encumbrance Analysis
features.description: Track and analyze encumbrances across the portfolio.

features.name: CAM Reconciliation
features.description: AI-driven CAM reconciliation with automated identification of caps, exclusions, and audit rights.

features.name: Rent Roll Reconciliation
features.description: Automated rent roll verification reducing material financial errors.

features.name: Investor Reporting
features.description: Real-time performance metrics and financial analysis for investor communications.

pros: Free instant lease abstraction tool lowers barrier to try
Purpose-built for CRE — not adapted from generic document management
Strong client roster including Nuveen, RXR, Spear Street Capital
Addresses the critical problem that 53% of rent rolls contain material errors
Self-updating stacking plans save significant manual effort
cons: Primarily focused on lease abstraction — not a full property management platform
Enterprise pricing for full platform not publicly available
Smaller company with limited market recognition vs. established players
Requires good quality lease document scans for best AI results

title: Dottid
headline: Leasing workflow management software for CRE.
description: Dottid is a modern leasing workflow management platform built specifically for commercial real estate asset managers and their teams. The platform aligns leasing teams around deal pipelines, capital projects, and portfolio performance for office, industrial, and retail properties. Dottid combines deal tracking, stacking plans, dynamic projections, ARGUS MLA integration, task management, file sharing, and team workspaces into one cohesive platform. It replaces email chains, spreadsheets, and disconnected CRE tools with real-time collaboration and actionable intelligence. SOC II compliant with strong data privacy commitments.
short_description: Leasing workflow management software for CRE.

title: Tango
headline: Real estate solutions for streamlining portfolio operations.
description: Tango is an industry-acclaimed real estate and facilities management platform that powers every stage of the property lifecycle — from site selection to sustainability. The platform serves corporate and retail real estate teams with solutions for lease management, space utilization, project and maintenance management, energy and sustainability tracking, and workplace optimization. Tango helps organizations reduce their second-largest expense (real estate) by optimizing portfolios, improving space utilization, and driving sustainability compliance. Strong presence in retail with store performance prediction and market analysis.

Nakisa's AI platform delivers decision intelligence across all modules, helping enterprises optimize real estate portfolios and streamline operations.

title: InvestNext
headline: Real estate investment management platform for GPs and sponsors.
description: InvestNext is a people-centered real estate investment management platform built for General Partners, investor relations teams, and finance leaders to access, nurture, and manage capital. The platform covers the full capital lifecycle: raising capital (fundraising, payments, capital calls, co-sponsors, fund structures), nurturing investors (portal, CRM, integrations), managing investments (distributions, cap table management, documents, K-1s, fund administration), and compliance (accreditation, KYC/AML, security). InvestNext democratizes real estate investing by delivering streamlined solutions for sponsors.
short_description: Real estate investment management platform for GPs and sponsors.

title: Covercy
headline: Investment management platform with embedded banking for CRE.
description: Covercy is a CRE investment management platform that uniquely combines investment management software with embedded banking. It enables GPs and syndicators to manage fundraising, investor relations, distributions, and banking — all from one platform. Covercy's embedded banking eliminates the need for separate bank accounts and manual wire transfers, allowing automated distribution payments directly from the platform. The system covers investor CRM, fundraising automation, waterfall distributions, reporting, and compliance.
short_description: Investment management platform with embedded banking for CRE.

features.description: Track and manage deals from sourcing through closing with pipeline visibility.

Originally a leading CRE crowdfunding marketplace, CrowdStreet has evolved into a broader alternative investments platform. CrowdStreet also offers technology solutions for sponsors to manage fundraising and investor relations.

It provides contact management, property tracking, deal pipeline management, and activity logging in a simple, ready-to-use interface. STRATAFOLIO handles lease reminders, invoice generation, payments, and reporting while connecting seamlessly to QuickBooks for real-time financial clarity. title: IBM TRIRIGA
headline: Intelligent real estate and facilities management by IBM.
description: IBM TRIRIGA (now IBM Maximo Real Estate and Facilities) is an enterprise integrated workplace management system (IWMS) for managing real estate portfolios, facilities, space, and sustainability. TRIRIGA has evolved by being repackaged into IBM Maximo Application Suite (MAS), retaining all TRIRIGA capabilities including real estate management, lease accounting, space management, facilities maintenance, capital projects, and environmental sustainability. IBM TRIRIGA serves Fortune 500 enterprises with complex global real estate portfolios requiring enterprise-grade IWMS capabilities.
short_description: Intelligent real estate and facilities management by IBM.

features.name: Portfolio Management
features.description: Manage global real estate portfolios with lease tracking, financial analysis, and strategic planning.

features.name: Lease Administration
features.description: Full lease lifecycle management with critical dates, payments, and compliance.

features.name: Lease Accounting
features.description: ASC 842 and IFRS 16 compliance with automated calculations and journal entries.

features.name: Transaction Management
features.description: Manage real estate transactions including acquisitions, dispositions, and renewals.

features.name: Space Management
features.description: Space allocation, utilization tracking, and dynamic space planning.

features.name: Workplace Services
features.description: Room booking, desk reservation, and workplace experience management.

features.name: Move Management
features.description: Plan and execute office relocations with resource coordination.

features.name: Maintenance Management
features.description: Work order management, preventive maintenance, and asset lifecycle tracking.

features.name: Capital Project Management
features.description: Manage construction and renovation projects with budgets and schedules.

features.name: Environmental Sustainability
features.description: Energy management, carbon footprint tracking, and sustainability reporting.

pros: Enterprise-grade IWMS for Fortune 500 companies
Comprehensive coverage of RE, facilities, space, and sustainability
Now part of IBM Maximo — broader asset management capabilities
Strong compliance features for lease accounting standards
cons: Very expensive — IBM enterprise pricing
Extremely complex implementation often requiring IBM consultants
Being folded into Maximo creates transition uncertainty
Overkill for most CRE firms — designed for massive corporate occupiers

title: Corrigo
headline: Enterprise CMMS and facility management by JLL Technologies.
description: Corrigo (by JLL Technologies) is a leading cloud-based computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) and facilities management platform. It helps property managers, facility teams, and service providers manage work orders, preventive maintenance, vendor networks, and asset management at scale. Corrigo is widely used in commercial real estate for managing building maintenance operations, tracking equipment lifecycles, and coordinating with vendors. As part of JLL Technologies, Corrigo benefits from JLL's deep facilities management expertise.
short_description: Enterprise CMMS and facility management by JLL Technologies.

features.name: Service Request Management
features.description: Capture, route, and track service requests from creation through resolution.

features.name: Automated Dispatch
features.description: Intelligent work order routing to appropriate vendors or internal teams.

features.name: SLA Tracking
features.description: Monitor service level compliance with automated alerts and escalations.

features.name: Mobile Access
features.description: Field technician mobile app for work order updates and documentation.

features.name: Preventive Maintenance
features.description: Schedule-based and condition-based preventive maintenance programs.

features.name: Asset Management
features.description: Track equipment inventory, condition, warranty, and lifecycle costs.

features.name: Inventory Management
features.description: Parts and materials inventory tracking for maintenance operations.

features.name: Vendor Network
features.description: Manage vendor profiles, qualifications, and performance scorecards.

features.name: Procurement
features.description: RFP management, bid comparison, and purchase order automation.

features.name: Invoice Management
features.description: Vendor invoice processing, approval workflows, and payment tracking.

pros: Industry-leading CMMS for commercial real estate
Part of JLL Technologies — deep FM expertise
Strong vendor management and procurement features
Scalable for large multi-site portfolios
cons: Enterprise pricing — not accessible for small property managers
Part of JLL ecosystem — may not suit competitors' clients
Implementation complexity for large deployments
Limited property management accounting features

title: LightBox
headline: Commercial real estate data, analytics, and workflow platform.
description: LightBox is a connected data platform for commercial real estate providing the most comprehensive property data, integrated CRE workflows, and industry connections. LightBox products include ClientLook CRM for brokers, Real Capital Markets (RCM) for deal marketing, LightBox Vision for property data intelligence, and PARCEL for environmental data. The platform serves brokers, lenders, investors, and developers with tools to locate properties, analyze data, and act on decisions with confidence. Backed by Silver Lake.
short_description: Commercial real estate data, analytics, and workflow platform.

features.name: LightBox Vision
features.description: Comprehensive property characteristics, tax parcels, building footprints, and spatial data.

features.name: Property Reports
features.description: Detailed property reports with ownership, transaction history, and assessor data.

features.name: Environmental Data (PARCEL)
features.description: Environmental risk data, phase I reports, and regulatory compliance information.

features.name: ClientLook CRM
features.description: CRE-specific CRM for contact management, property tracking, and deal pipeline.

features.name: Real Capital Markets (RCM)
features.description: Investment sales marketing platform connecting sellers with qualified buyers.

features.name: Listing Syndication
features.description: Distribute property listings across marketing channels.

features.name: Location Intelligence
features.description: Spatial analytics and data layers for site selection and market analysis.

features.name: Market Analytics
features.description: Market-level data and trends for investment and lending decisions.

features.name: Custom Reports
features.description: Tailored reporting for lenders, investors, and brokers.

pros: Most comprehensive CRE data platform — property, environmental, and spatial data
ClientLook and RCM are well-known broker tools
Strong testimonials from major firms (CBRE, Cushman & Wakefield)
Connected platform linking data, workflows, and people
cons: Product portfolio can be confusing — many separate tools
Pricing not transparent
RCM faces competition from newer platforms like Crexi
Some products feel like separate acquisitions rather than unified platform

title: Cadre
headline: Private market real estate investment platform.
description: Cadre was a pioneering technology-driven real estate investment platform that provided accredited and institutional investors direct access to institutional-quality commercial real estate deals. Founded by Ryan Williams, Cadre used data science and technology to source, underwrite, and manage CRE investments. In 2025, Cadre joined with Willow Wealth to provide broader private market alternatives including private equity, private credit, real estate, and venture capital. Existing Cadre investors can continue to monitor portfolios through their Cadre accounts while new investors are directed to Willow Wealth.
short_description: Private market real estate investment platform.

features.name: Direct CRE Deals
features.description: Access to institutional-quality commercial real estate investments.

features.name: Data-Driven Underwriting
features.description: Technology-powered deal sourcing and underwriting using proprietary data.

features.name: Portfolio Management
features.description: Track investment performance, distributions, and documents through the platform.

features.name: Private Markets Access
features.description: Broad access to private equity, credit, real estate, and venture capital.

features.name: Portfolio Building
features.description: Build diversified portfolios across private market alternatives.

features.name: Account Management
features.description: Manage investments and access statements through the platform.

pros: Pioneer in technology-driven CRE investment access
Now offers broader private market alternatives via Willow Wealth
Existing investors retain portfolio access
cons: Original Cadre CRE platform effectively wound down
Only for accredited investors
Transition to Willow Wealth may confuse existing users
Less CRE-specific than before the merger

title: Quarem
headline: Corporate real estate and lease management software.
description: Quarem is a lease management platform based in Houston, TX that combines technology with dedicated client services for comprehensive lease administration. Unlike fully automated platforms, Quarem believes the best lease management strategy comes from technology and people working together. All core components — technology, client services, abstracting, and leadership — are under one roof, meaning clients work with real people who know their leases. Quarem provides lease abstraction, critical date management, payment tracking, and portfolio analytics.
short_description: Corporate real estate and lease management software.

features.name: Lease Abstraction
features.description: Professional lease abstraction services by in-house CRE experts.

features.name: Critical Date Management
features.description: Track and alert on lease expirations, renewals, and option dates.

features.name: Payment Tracking
features.description: Monitor rent payments, escalations, and obligation schedules.

features.name: Portfolio Dashboard
features.description: Centralized view of lease portfolio with key metrics and reporting.

features.name: Dedicated Support
features.description: Named client service representatives who know your specific leases.

features.name: Audit Services
features.description: Lease audit and reconciliation services for CAM and operating expenses.

features.name: Custom Reporting
features.description: Tailored reports for stakeholders including finance, legal, and operations.

pros: Combines technology with dedicated human client services
All operations under one roof — no outsourced call centers
Strong lease abstraction services
Personal relationship model preferred by many corporate tenants
cons: Pricing not publicly available
Service model may not scale as efficiently as pure SaaS
Smaller company with limited technology innovation vs. pure tech platforms
Houston-based — less geographic diversity in team

title: TheAnalyst PRO
headline: CRE investment analysis and marketing platform for brokers.
description: TheAnalyst PRO by CRE Tech is the #1 CRE investment modeling and DCF software platform, combining investment analysis, lease analysis, demographic analysis, offering memorandums, flyers, brochures, and infographics in one subscription. The platform creates sophisticated financial analysis reports in minutes, not hours, replacing clunky spreadsheets with professionally designed, branded output. It includes 5 and 10-year cash flow analysis (before and after tax), demographic mapping with infographics, comprehensive offering memorandums, and lease vs. own analysis. Priced at $699.99/year or $89.99/month.
short_description: CRE investment analysis and marketing platform for brokers.

features.name: DCF Modeling
features.description: 5 and 10-year discounted cash flow analysis with IRR, NPV, and equity multiples.

features.name: Cash Flow Analysis
features.description: Before and after tax cash flow projections with detailed assumptions.

features.name: Lease Analysis
features.description: Single lease analysis or side-by-side comparison of up to 5 leases.

features.name: Lease vs Own Analysis
features.description: Comprehensive lease vs. purchase analysis for tenants and investors.

features.name: Offering Memorandums
features.description: Professional OMs generated in minutes with branded templates and financial data.

features.name: Flyers & Brochures
features.description: Marketing materials with property details, photos, and financial highlights.

features.name: Infographics
features.description: Visual demographic and market infographics for property marketing.

features.name: Property Websites
features.description: Individual property marketing websites generated from analysis data.

features.name: Demographic Analysis
features.description: Comprehensive demographic mapping with population, income, and household data.

features.name: Traffic Count Reports
features.description: Vehicle and pedestrian traffic count reports for retail site analysis.

features.name: Location Risk Analysis
features.description: Risk assessment for property locations including environmental and market factors.

Creates professional reports in minutes — massive time savings
Transparent, affordable pricing ($699.99/year)
7-day free trial to evaluate
Cloud-based — works on any device

title: MSCI Real Capital Analytics
headline: Global commercial property transaction data and analytics.
description: MSCI Real Assets (formerly Real Capital Analytics/RCA) provides the industry's leading global CRE transaction data, analytics, and performance benchmarking. Covers $50T+ in transactions, $2T+ in private real estate assets, 120,000+ investor/lender profiles, and 80+ performance indexes across 170+ countries. Institutional investors, fund managers, and lenders use MSCI for performance attribution, transaction screening, and climate risk assessment.
short_description: Global commercial property transaction data and analytics.

features.name: Global Transaction Database
features.description: $50T+ in CRE transactions across 170+ countries.

features.name: Investor & Lender Profiles
features.description: 120,000+ profiles with transaction histories.

features.name: Deal Screening
features.description: Search transactions by property type, size, location, buyer/seller.

features.name: Performance Indexes
features.description: 80+ real estate performance indexes for benchmarking.

features.name: Attribution Analysis
features.description: Isolate performance drivers for asset allocation decisions.

features.name: Risk Analytics
features.description: Portfolio risk including concentration and liquidity.

features.name: Climate Risk Assessment
features.description: Physical and transition climate risk evaluation.

features.name: ESG Analytics
features.description: ESG scoring and reporting for RE portfolios.

features.name: Scenario Testing
features.description: Test portfolio decisions against climate risk exposure.

Gold standard benchmarking with 80+ indexes
40+ years experience via IPD acquisition
Leading climate risk analytics

title: Moody's REIS
headline: CRE market analytics, forecasting, and risk assessment by Moody's.
description: Moody's Analytics CRE (formerly REIS) provides commercial real estate market data, econometric forecasting, and analytics for institutional investors, lenders, and developers. Covers rents, vacancies, absorption, and construction data across all major US metros and submarkets for office, retail, industrial, apartment, and flex/R&D. Combines historical data with proprietary forecasting models projecting market performance 5-10 years out.
short_description: CRE market analytics, forecasting, and risk assessment by Moody's.

features.description: Rent, vacancy, absorption, and construction data across US markets.

features.name: Submarket Data

features.name: Historical Trends
features.description: Long-term historical data for cycle analysis.

features.name: Econometric Forecasts
features.description: Proprietary models forecasting rents, vacancies 5-10 years out.

features.name: Scenario Analysis

features.name: Risk Assessment

features.description: Automated reports for underwriting and investment committees.

features.name: Data Feeds
features.description: API access for integration into internal models.

features.name: Property Analysis
features.description: Property-level analysis within market context.
